answers.answer: I have PCOS since 13 and they only diagnosed it 2 years ago...nothing too bad, you can still get pregnant but it might take a while...I first got preggo with Clomid but miscarred, now I used injectables and am preggo again..only 5 weeks though...Good luck
Do you know of anyone who got pregnant just take provera to regulate their cycle?

There's a lot of them. But, most are on the pregnancy forum now or the maternal forum. They still drop in from time to time. Just not on a daily basis anymore :)  But, yes. It does really help with regulating a cycle. It mimics the Luteal phase of you cycle. A great place to start.

Thanks! I was afraid they were just finding something for me to do until it has been a year of TTC, just so I wouldnt feel like I was doing nothing. I feel better now. I cant wait to start trying, for real. lol

question: I just got my results back from my doctor, he says that I have PCOS. Good thing is that he didnt see any cysts on the ultrasound, so it could be worse. I have high cholesterol and high free testosterone and he wants me to be tested for diabetes. Since we are TTC but it has only been 5 months he put me on Provera. He said it would make me have a period and then if I take it again on cycle day 12-22 it should also help me ovulate. If anyone else has been on this before please let me know, he seemed certain but I haven't heard of this helping to get pregnant. I am supposed to see him again in 2 months so he knows if the provera is doing its job and after the magic year mark of TTC he might try something like Clomid.
title: Results from doctor
